questions.question_text: A wireless technician wants to implement a technology that will allow user devices to automatically navigate to the best available frequency standard. Which of the following technologies should the technician use?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
Band steering is a technology that helps client devices connect to the best available frequency band (e.g., 2.4 GHz or 5 GHz) by encouraging dual-band devices to use the less congested and higher-performing 5 GHz band when available. This optimizes network performance and reduces congestion on the 2.4 GHz band.

questions.question_text: A user called the help desk after business hours to complain that files on a device are inaccessible and the wallpaper was changed. The network administrator thinks that this issue is an isolated incident, but the security analyst thinks the issue might be a ransomware attack. Which of the following troubleshooting steps should be taken first?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
A. Identify the problem, should always be the first step

questions.question_text: A data center interconnect using a VXLAN was recently implemented. A network engineer observes slow performance and fragmentation on the interconnect. Which of the following technologies will resolve the issue?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
D. Jumbo Frames is the only option that will fix fragmentation

Selected Answer: B
If the server is online and accessible within its trusted zone, but users in the perimeter network cannot reach it, the most likely issue is that the firewall rules are blocking access. Firewalls control network traffic and can prevent unauthorized access. Updating the firewall Access Control List (ACL) to allow connections to the new server from the perimeter network would resolve this issue.

choices.C: Configure a static route for the user VLAN to the new server.
choices.A: Create a TXT record on the DNS server for the new server.
choices.D: Insert a static ARP entry for the new server on the Layer 3 switch.
choices.B: Update the firewall ACL to allow access to the new server.

questions.question_text: A new server is deployed in a trusted zone and is validated to be online with all appropriate services running. However, users in a perimeter network cannot access the server. Which of the following should a network administrator do to resolve the reported issue?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
Dig queries DNS, nmap is for port scanning, tracert is for looking at network routing, and telnet is for remote command line as asked in the question

questions.question_text: Network administrators are using the Telnet protocol to administer network devices that are on the 192.168.1.0/24 subnet. Which of the following tools should the administrator use to best identify the devices?
